medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patients III-1 and III-5 presented with AML. Patient III-1 was diagnosed at age 30 in February 2003, while his sister, Patient III-5, was diagnosed a week later at age 18. Both experienced arthralgias, fever, and malaise following chemotherapy, but their white cell counts increased without overt sepsis. Their leukocyte abnormalities resolved without intervention, and they have remained well over 20 months since diagnosis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The father of the patients had AML during childhood and is currently in remission. The father was diagnosed at age 10 in September 1963 and had multiple relapses.
medical_history.family_history: There is a family history of acute myeloid leukemia; both siblings (Patients III-1 and III-5) have the same CEBPA mutation, while their father had AML during childhood.
